intro: Prestonia brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
